column1: Which of the following numbers is a rational number?
column7: A rational number is any number that can be expressed in the form p/q
column8: where p and q are integers and q ≠ 0.

column1: Which set is closed under addition, subtraction, and multiplication but not division?
What is the additive identity for rational numbers?
column7: Adding 0 to any rational number gives the same number

column1: What is the result of multiplying any rational number with 1?
column7: 1 is the multiplicative identity for rational numbers.

column1: Which of the following operations is not closed in the set of whole numbers?
column7: Whole numbers are not closed under subtraction.

column1: Which operation is not commutative for rational numbers?
column7: Subtraction is not commutative for rational numbers.

column7: This is the property of commutativity.

column1: Which operation is associative for rational numbers?
column7: Addition is associative for rational numbers.

column7: Rational numbers are closed under all operations except division by zero.
